pages.text: Gunfire erupted from the upper catwalks of our small ship. I ran from the Dr. Thatch's quarters to the source. The Sargeant, PK-90 in ready position, was behind cover. $(br2)I saw no one run past me so our intruder had slipped past us. I pulled my trusty sidearm, Stampede, and we continued the sweep.

Once again, alarms rang and buzzers sounded. This time, it was the fuel tanks and thrusters. As I ran to the control console in engineering bay, I saw an escape pod released out the port window. It was not of Overworld design. Perhaps it was attached to the ship, cloaked, and scanner couldn't read it. $(br2)But that was a problem for another time.

I approached the control console to see a frantic and energized engineer. Ms. Shuster gave him a sedative so I could at least get the information straight. $(br2)The ship was on full systems critical. There was no recovering. Someone had sabataged our ship.
